claude-code.description: In Claude Code, prime context by reading key files at the start of a session or including them in your prompt.
claude-code.code:
# Start of session — prime the agent:

Read these files to understand the project:
- package.json (dependencies and scripts)
- src/lib/db.ts (database layer)
- src/types/index.ts (shared types)

Now implement a new endpoint for user profiles
that follows the patterns in src/api/users.ts.

cursor.description: In Cursor, use @file references to include specific files in the agent's context window.
cursor.code:
# Using @file to prime context:

@src/lib/db.ts @src/types/index.ts @src/api/users.ts

Create a new API endpoint for user profiles.
Follow the same patterns as the users endpoint —
same return shape, same error handling,
same validation approach.

copilot.description: In Copilot Chat, use #file references to attach files as context for your prompt.
copilot.code:
# Using #file to prime context:

#file:src/lib/db.ts #file:src/types/index.ts
#file:src/api/users.ts

Create a new API endpoint for user profiles
following the same patterns as users.ts.

windsurf.description: In Windsurf, reference files with @-mentions to include them in the agent's context.
windsurf.code:
# Using @-mentions to prime context:

@src/lib/db.ts @src/types/index.ts @src/api/users.ts

Build a user profiles endpoint matching the
patterns in the users API — same return shape,
error handling, and validation approach.
